note.p: Career: Offered a chair of mathematics at the University of Bologna by Vincenzo Viviani (FRS 1696), but declined; Professor of Civil Law at Pisa (1687-death); tutor in law to Gian Gastone de' Medici (1688); offered a chair of law at Turin but declined; at his death, he left his money to the poor and his library to the University of Pisa
Notes: Jocher gives date of birth as 20 May 1662. Proposed by John Chamberlayne
